search_results.snippet: The Clouds (Gr: Nephelai) is a comedy by the ancient Greek playwright Aristophanes, originally produced at the Athens City Dionysia of 423 BCE. It is perhaps the world's first extant comedy of ideas and lampoons intellectual fashions in classical Athens.
